title: error in hostnames
body:
For my pihole installation I have subscribed to  https://raw.githubusercontent.com/StevenBlack/hosts/master/hosts

The latest version of pihole complains about some invalid domain names in the list.

``` [i] Target: https://raw.githubusercontent.com/StevenBlack/hosts/master/hosts
  [✓] Status: Retrieval successful
  [i] Analyzed 168834 domains, 15 domains invalid!
      Sample of invalid domains:
      - 0.0.0.0
      - broadcasthost
      - fe
      - ff
```

After checking in the file I found this

```
#<localhost>
0.0.0.0 fe #00::0 ip6-localnet
0.0.0.0 ff #00::0 ip6-mcastprefix
#fe80::1%lo0	localhost
#</localhost>
```

There seems to be some error in this. I would suggest 

```
# The following lines are desirable for IPv6 capable hosts
0.0.0.0 fe00::0 # ip6-localnet
0.0.0.0 ff00::0 # ip6-mcastprefix
0.0.0.0 ff02::1 # ip6-allnodes
0.0.0.0 ff02::2 # ip6-allrouters
0.0.0.0 ff02::3 # ip6-allhosts
```

title: Non-github mirrors deprecated?
body:
Hi! 
First thing, thanks for all the work.

I am an Hostsman for Win user and I noticed that the non github mirrors are not updates since 30 Nov, they're not actively supported anymore and I missed the announce or anything bad happened? 

Thanks!

title: An important link is defunct in README
body:
[This Section](https://github.com/StevenBlack/hosts#warning-using-this-hosts-file-in-windows-may-require-disabling-dns-cache-service) contains the following block of text:
> Use the disable-dnscache-service-win.cmd file to make proper changes to the Windows registry. You will need to reboot your device once that's done. See the [the comments within the cmd file](https://github.com/StevenBlack/hosts/blob/master/disable-dnscache-service-win.cmd) for more details.

The link given in this block is outdated. It needs to be replaced by [this link](https://github.com/StevenBlack/hosts/blob/master/disable-dnscache-service-win.bat)

title: cdn.paddle.com
body: $subject blocks access to https://play.pocketcasts.com/podcasts. Please could it be whitelisted in the master list unless there is very good reason for it to be present?

title: hosts file has line with unexpected content
body:
Hello,

I am using this repo as a source to build more "intellectual" filters lists for AdGuard Home.
I use some scripts to collapse the content and apply using regexp, as AdGuard Home supports it.

The following line which I found in "hosts" file (admalware) doesn't make sense and breaking my filters, leaving "www" only, which prohibit using any domain name starting from "www".
  
user@linux:/tmp $ cat hosts | grep "0.0.0.0 www "
0.0.0.0 www #.104.248.94.172
user@linux:/tmp $

title: Extra newlines in generated hosts file around comments
body:
When I run `python3 updateHostsFile.py`  then scroll to the bottom of the generated `hosts` file I see this:

```
#

# The contents of this file (containing a listing of additional domains in

# 'hosts' file format) are appended to the unified hosts file during the

# update process.



0.0.0.0 someblacklisteddomain.com
```

Which comes from the blacklist file, however in the blacklist file those lines look like this:

```
# blacklist
#
# The contents of this file (containing a listing of additional domains in
# 'hosts' file format) are appended to the unified hosts file during the
# update process.

0.0.0.0 someblacklisteddomain.com
```

Somehow the script is inserting extra newline characters, but only around empty lines (`/^\s?\n/` in regex parlance)  and lines that start with comments  (`/\s?#.*/` in regex parlance). 

Additionally comments after a valid line are being stripped, so for example.

In blacklist...
```
0.0.0.0 someblacklisteddomain.com  # some comment here
```
Becomes...
```
0.0.0.0 someblacklisteddomain.com
```

Interestingly, `myhosts` is not affected by this issue. Inline comments at the end of valid hosts rules are left as-is, and there are no extra newlines between normal comment blocks.

all 3-rd party blocklists and the included custom `blacklist` are both affected by this. Example:

```
# Start adaway.org

# AdAway default blocklist

# Blocking mobile ad providers and some analytics providers

# 
```

title: None of the sbc.io mirror links work
body:
I use the mirror links on [sbc.io](http://sbc.io) to reduce the load to github (and to prevent your account from getting banned due to heavy request), but I noticed that non of the mirrors work. Every single link gives a **500 - Internal server error**. Even the [main site](http://sbc.io) won't load.

Can you check into that?

title: www.googleapis.com
body: This list seems to be blocking www.googleapis.com which breaks the Google Drive Windows app (Backup and Sync by Google).

title: Still issues with someonewhocares.org
body:
Hi Nissar @funilrys I wonder if you could address the following new side-effect.  No rush, but soon.

I just regenerated hosts and the diff of [someonewhocares.org data](http://someonewhocares.org/hosts/zero/hosts) shows the following.  We're mangling author comments here.  This is not good.

Can we please not mangle comment lines, especially these lines which are clear, simple comments?

![2018-03-04_14-03-46](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/80144/36949411-07bee08a-1fb6-11e8-87b0-4fac5230abba.jpg)

title: Updating hosts data should not clobber existing hosts data if updating source times out or fails
body: Currently if a hosts update fails for any reason, we delete the old pre-existing source's hosts file.

body:
The latest commit:
commit 57451df2986f3ccbc15c0410caa6fcb662095045 (HEAD -> master, origin/master, origin/HEAD)
Author: Steven Black <steveb@stevenblack.com>
Date:   Thu Nov 16 20:58:38 2017 -0500

    New data from yoyo.org, someonewhocares.org, and Badd-Boyz.

Breaks my generated dnsmasq.  All hosts fail to resolve after it is loaded.

The script I'm using to generate is here: 

https://gist.github.com/jac18281828/31deef842ec0aa7a6f04bdc249da392f

I'm also attaching a diff between the good file and the bad one, but I can't tell what the problem is in my first pass at looking at it.

[adlist.generated.diff.txt](https://github.com/StevenBlack/hosts/files/1484615/adlist.generated.diff.txt)

title: updateHostsFile.py fails to download from KADhosts under Python 2.7
body:
Seeing this under Python 2.7.

     Error in updating source:  https://raw.githubusercontent.com/azet12/KADhosts/master/KADhosts.txt

I suspect that [`write_data`](https://github.com/StevenBlack/hosts/blob/2bb7c27269edfa503fb2ce251e0c721dea288eb4/updateHostsFile.py#L889-L904) is failing because of newly added cyrillic characters in commit 2bb7c27269edfa503fb2ce251e0c721dea288eb4.

title: ./makehosts crashing on macOS
body:
On macOS I'm getting this (below) for all data.

    Updating source ./data/adaway.org from https://...
    Error in updating source:  https://...
    Updating source ./data/add.2o7Net from https://...
    Error in updating source:  https://...
    etc...

Testing I find it works great at 65f0421, so commit 2ff5dc2 looks to be the cause.

title: Generation broken in Python versions below 3.5
body: Because of the new use of `glob( ... "/**/" ...)` the generation program is broken in versions of Python below 3.5.

title: Unpredictable whitelist behavior with subdomains or at least 'analytics.twitter.com'
body:
Hey Steven, love this repo and everything you've been doing with it. As in the title, I have included analytics.twitter.com (and just twitter.com) in my whitelist file, and the results aren't quite as expected. twitter.com in the whitelist properly unblocks urls.api.twitter.com, scribe.twitter.com and p.twitter.com (not the 3 I am concerned with) but fails to remove analytics from the final generated file. Including the hostname explicitly also does not work. analytics.twitter.com is now an actual UI-driven way to view the engagement on your tweets, which I find sometimes interesting haha, but I can't seem to get it unblocked using the generative methods I use for many other hosts without a problem. Just looking to see if you had any insight as to why that may be happening, if it's potentially on purpose, etc.

Thanks again!
Will

title: Flush DNS fails on Ubuntu 15.10
body:
Running the script fails when flushing DNS. For some reason these commands fail:

`sudo /etc/rc.d/init.d/nscd restart`
`sudo systemctl restart network.service`

And this one works:

`sudo systemctl restart networking.service`

Ubuntu 15.10 has the service running as `networking.service`

title: script run with --noupdate should not ask "Do you want to update all data sources?"
body:
> python updateHostsFile.py -n
> ←[94mDo you want to update all data sources?←[0m [Y/n]

the culprit is

> response = "yes" if auto else query_yes_no("Do you want to update all data sources?")
>     if response == "yes" and update:

query_yes_no should not be asked for update=False set by `update = not args.noUpdate`

title: updateHostsFile crashes when run under path contains CJK characters
body:
## Console output

```
~/工作空間/第三方專案/Amalgamated hosts file$ python updateHostsFile.py --help
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "updateHostsFile.py", line 78, in <module>
    DATA_PATH           = os.path.join(BASEDIR_PATH, 'data')
  File "/usr/lib/python2.7/posixpath.py", line 73, in join
    path += '/' + b
UnicodeDecodeError: 'ascii' codec can't decode byte 0xe5 in position 14: ordinal not in range(128)
```
## Reporter's Environment
### Operating System

Ubuntu 15.10 AMD64
### Python

2.7.10
### Amalgamated hosts file

commit 231dc436
### Locale

```
LANG=zh_TW.UTF-8
LANGUAGE=zh_TW:zh_HK:zh_CN:en_US:en
LC_CTYPE="zh_TW.UTF-8"
LC_NUMERIC=zh_TW.UTF-8
LC_TIME=zh_TW.UTF-8
LC_COLLATE="zh_TW.UTF-8"
LC_MONETARY=zh_TW.UTF-8
LC_MESSAGES="zh_TW.UTF-8"

LC_ADDRESS=zh_TW.UTF-8
LC_TELEPHONE=zh_TW.UTF-8

LC_ALL=
```

title: Duplicate entries found.
body:

May seem not so critical, but may break particular systems.

Also line `200459` violates file format consistency.

title: localhost points to 0.0.0.0
body: It should point to 127.0.0.1 or not included. (most systems handle this automatically)
